subject: Attention: The Recipient,
body:
Attention: The Recipient,
               Your Blocked Outstanding Payment Refers.
The President of the Federal Republic of Nigeria has directed the  Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) to pay all outstanding and blocked payments owed to contractors/ Inheritance and Scam Victims  with immediate effect and your name is among those to receive their payments.
Kindly confirm if the account details stated below are yours.
Bank Name:RCB Bank Ltd.
Bank Address: 1, Avlonos street,Maria House, 1075, Nicosia, Cyprus.
USD A/C No.: 036201001
USD IBAN: CY85 1260 0000 0000 0000 3620 1001
Swift Code: RCBLCY2I
Beneficiary: Gulfstream Europe Ltd.
These funds will be transferred to the above bank account upon my instruction to our remittance department. However, if you are not aware of this payment and did not authorize the transfer of the funds into the above bank account or if the above bank account is not nominated by you; kindly notify me immediately.
Your prompt response to this mail will help us facilitate the process of the funds transfer of your overdue payment.
Best regards
Dr.Olayemi Michael Cardoso
Governor of Central Bank of Nigeria(CBN)
Federal Republic of Nigeria
+234-814-704-8347

subject: Re:   Attention: The Recipient,
body:
Hello Michael Cardoso,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I must say, this is quite a surprise! I wasn't expecting any payments from the Federal Republic of Nigeria. Could you please tell me more about how my name ended up on this list? 

Also, I'm not sure which account details you're referring to as there seems to be no information provided in your message. Could you clarify that for me?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Verna

subject: Re: Attention: The Recipient,
body:
Attention: Verna  ,

                         Your Blocked Outstanding Payment Refers.

This is to acknowledge the receipt of your message  was well noted.When you
go through the letter again you will know the reason  why your  name was
listed among those  that the Federal Government of Nigeria decided to pay
outstanding payment.

You are advised to forward your bank account details and your address,
whatsapp number, a copy of your id card. Find attached fund processing form
fill and return back.

Your prompt response to this mail will help us facilitate the process of
the funds transfer of your overdue payment.
Best regards

Dr.Olayemi Michael Cardoso
Governor of Central Bank of Nigeria(CBN)
Federal Republic of Nigeria
+234-814-704-8347

subject: Re: Attention: The Recipient,
body:
Hello Michael Cardoso,

Thank you for your message. It's quite interesting to hear about this situation. I must admit, I'm a bit surprised to find my name listed for a payment from the Federal Government of Nigeria.

Could you please provide more details about why my name was selected? And what is the nature of this overdue payment?

I noticed that you've asked for some personal information. However, I feel more comfortable discussing further details before sharing any sensitive data.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Verna

subject: Re: Attention: The Recipient,
body:
Hello Michael Cardoso,

Thank you for your message. It's quite interesting to hear about this situation. I'm curious, how did my name end up on the list of people that the Federal Government of Nigeria decided to pay? 

Also, could you please explain more about this fund processing form? What kind of information does it require?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Verna

subject: Re: Attention: The Recipient,
body:
Attention: Verna  ,

                         Your Blocked Outstanding Payment Refers.

 The payment  stands  in three category stated: contractors/ Inheritance
and Scam Victims  which  your name was listed among those to receive their
payments.

You are advised to forward your bank account details and your address,
whatsapp number, a copy of your id card. Find attached fund processing form
fill and return back.

Your prompt response to this mail will help us facilitate the process of
the funds transfer of your overdue payment.
Best regards

Dr.Olayemi Michael Cardoso
Governor of Central Bank of Nigeria(CBN)
Federal Republic of Nigeria
+234-814-704-8347
